item.title: Can you do this with a command....?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

why do i need to declare it??

[b]illegal start of expression [/b]

The error message will point to perfectly good code. Look just ahead of it for a missing } or ;
static int x = 0; Static variables have to be defined outside all methods inside a class.
you wrote x + = 2; instead of x += 2;
you wrote case: STRAWBERRY instead of case STRAWBERRY :
You nested a method inside another method.

They are the reasons this error message can happen.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you do this with a command....?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

i get an error:

client.java:10834: not a statement c.customCommand("jail1") || c.customCommand("jail2"); ^ 1 error You have sucsessfully compiled Press any key to continue . . .

i also tried this:

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3228; || teleportToY = ####; c.teleportToY = 3407; || teleportToY = ####; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("You be released soon!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

but i get this:

client.java:10828: illegal start of expression c.teleportToX = 3228; || teleportToY = 2121; ^ client.java:10829: illegal start of expression c.teleportToY = 3407; || teleportToY = 2312; ^ 2 errors You have sucsessfully compiled Press any key to continue . . .[br][br][size=1]Posted on: February 17, 2009, 10:27:09 am[/size][hr][quote=“public boolean, post:5, topic:262740”]Here it is:

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3228; ,(NEw COORDS) c.teleportToY = 3407; ,(NEW COORDS) c.teleblock = true; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("You be released soon!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }[/quote]

i get:

client.java:10828: illegal start of expression c.teleportToX = 3228; ,(2312) ^ client.java:10829: illegal start of expression c.teleportToY = 3407; ,(2212) ^ 2 errors You have sucsessfully compiled Press any key to continue . . .

Here it is:

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3228; ,(NEw COORDS) c.teleportToY = 3407; ,(NEW COORDS) c.teleblock = true; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("You be released soon!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

item.title: Can you do this with a command....?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Try this code -

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.customCommand("jail1") || c.customCommand("jail2"); c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("You will be released soon!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

Then create the commands jail1 and jail2.

I’m not sure if it would work. Give it a try.

Read full topic

item.title: Can you do this with a command....?
item.dc:creator: @xxlukexx xxlukexx
item.description:
@xxlukexx wrote:

i am wondering if i could make my jail command so that it jails them in different places.

here is what i mean, this is my code:

if (command.startsWith("jail") && command.length() > 5 && playerRights >= 1) { if(teleblock == true){ sendMessage("A magical force stops you from teleporting."); //made by Musicmad441 } String name = command.substring(5); client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)]; c.teleportToX = 3228; c.teleportToY = 3407; c.teleblock = true; c.sendMessage("You have been thrown in jail for breaking the rules!"); c.sendMessage("You be released soon!"); c.teleblock = true; updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

i am wondering if i could make it so when i do jail, it teles the person to those coords or another set of coords…??

is that possible, if so please can someone tell me how i would do it. i think its something to do with | | (operaters) meaning OR.

i think you could make it tele to those coords OR (||) tele to the other coords.

please reply, if its possible or not, and if so how would i do it.

thanks,

Read full topic
item.source: Can you do this with a command....?
